remarks: The uniform limit property.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Feb-2015.)
statement:
ulm2.z $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
ulm2.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
ulm2.f $e |- ( ph -> F : Z --> ( CC ^m S ) ) $.
ulm2.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( k e. Z /\ z e. S ) ) -> ( ( F ` k ) ` z ) = B ) $.
ulm2.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ z e. S ) -> ( G ` z ) = A ) $.
ulmi.u $e |- ( ph -> F ( ~~>u ` S ) G ) $.
ulmi.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. RR+ ) $.
ulmi $p |- ( ph -> E. j e. Z A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` j ) A. z e. S ( abs ` ( B - A ) ) < C ) $.
$d A j k $.
$d C j k z $.
